intro: Jasione crispa subsp. cavanillesii, commonly known as the Cavanilles' bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. This subspecies is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of mountainous flora.
